channel.title: OpenClient
channel.description:
After releasing my model downloader I created an unexpected monster. People where manually adding itemdefs to their clients by means of hardcoding. This deeply saddened me and I havnt released much since. So it was back to the drawingboard for me, I needed to make something easy enough for you retards to use yet more efficient that hardcoding whole itemdefs. To do this I though I would simple create a ItemDef modification app that would add new defs via cache. However life is not that simple. The itemdef data is part of a "folder" of files. these files are compressed in some sort of jagex compression(a real pain in the ass). So I had a whole mess of things to work out and have recently found the interest to complete the first steps of the project. Since I have completed the first steps of removing the jagcompression and creating the update server. I though I would write this up and hopefully stay motivated.
[ul]Update Server: [list][li]JagRequests (finished)[/li] [li]OnDemandRequests (Finished)[/li] [/list]
[list] Cache Modification Applications [list][li]Jag Folder Pack (finished)[/li] [li]Modified JagCompression(GZip) compressor (finished)[/li] [li]OnDemand Data Crc Version editor (finished)[/li] [/list]
Demo Client (to stress test update server): http://openclient.silabsoft.org/[/list][/ul]

item.title: OpenClient
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

m.dog311:

He thinks Jagex is going to sue you for this.

Well they have tryed it on Mopar (and failed) and Silabsoft has done more “Hacking” or “Breaking their Terms & Conditions”

You have allready told us that your constantly getting DMCA Notices. How can your webclient still be there

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators). It isnt nice is it?

Read full topic

item.title: OpenClient
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

After getting moved into my new home I decided to continue with this project. The client is available to use currently having the default cache. I will soon be releasing a “item maker” allowing those that create custom models to add the item data with ease. I decided to use jogl for model views of models in itemdefs.


Read full topic
